title: [Ethereum] AWS EC2 instance keeps dying, block number does not increase
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: erigon version 2022.99.99-dev-832d9fd3

OS & Version: Linux, m5.2xlarge, storage: ssd gp3 2.3T

Commit hash : 

#### Expected behaviour
working fine.

#### Actual behaviour
AWS ec2 instance keeps dying with 'Instance reachability check failed' error.
This started happening from last friday(sep 16th) after the merge I guess.
If I restart the ec2 instance, it seems to works fine but the block number is stuck at 0xed150b. (both full node, archive node)
Is there anything that has been changed after the merge? 

Below is the logs that I got when erigon was running fine after ec2 restart.

This is what I got from top. Is my ec2 type too small for erigon to run? CPU seems to be normal(around 10% like the second image I posted) but sometimes CPU utilization goes over 100% like the first image.

<img width="645" alt="image" src="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/95335707/191440194-1336cf81-5936-44e9-91df-49cea78b32cc.png">
I've found out that erigon process is making memory hit 100%, and because of that kswapd0 process which swaps data when memory is lacking uses all the cpu making ec2 to freeze and die.
Would this be because my ec2 instance has low memory? Isn't m5.2xlarge enough for erigon ethereum full/archive node?
